features: Size: Designed to fit standard twin size mattress box type beds (dimensions specified), but please note that this might not be the queen size bed despite the brand name containing the term "queen."
Material: Made with CertiPUR-US certified mattress foams & OEKO-TEX Standard 100 textiles ensuring long-lasting comfort and support.

Packaging: With our advanced technology, we expertly compress the mattress into a single box, making shipping and maneuvering hassle-free. Upon unboxing, simply unroll the mattress, and it will take care of the rest. Within a span of 72 hours, it will effortlessly expand to its original shape, ready for a night of comfortable sleep.

Easy Inflation: The mattress can be easily inflated within the stipulated time frame under normal room temperature conditions.However, in colder areas, it may require a slightly longer time for full inflation. Please allow for proper acclimation in colder climates. Simply follow the provided instructions for inflation, and it will expand to its full size and shape.

Firmness: Medium Firm mattress designed to provide superior comfort and support. The mattress offers a balanced combination of firmness and cushioning, ensuring proper spinal alignment and pressure relief.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Next page 1 Enhanced Support 2 Foam 3 Firmness Level 4 Spring 5 The Product
Previous page Next page 1 Unboxing 2 Size & Sleeping Positions 3 Our Story

What exactly is a hybrid mattress? A hybrid mattress combines the best of both worlds, integrating the coil springs found in traditional innerspring mattresses with the plush comfort of memory foam. This dual construction provides an optimal balance of support, comfort & durability. What are the main benefits of choosing a hybrid mattress over other types? The hybrid mattress offers: Adaptive Support; Pressure Relief; Durability; Temperature Regulation; Reduced Motion Transfer How do I know if a hybrid mattress is the right choice for me? The suitability of a hybrid mattress depends on your individual preferences and needs. If you enjoy the combination of support and comfort, desire reduced motion transfer, or tend to sleep hot, a hybrid mattress could be an excellent choice. Do hybrid mattresses require any special maintenance or care? While hybrid mattresses are relatively low-maintenance, there are some essential care tips to ensure their longevity. Rotate your mattress every 3-6 months to promote even wear. and use a mattress protector can help prevent stains and damage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and comfortable!!
reviews.reviewText: I needed this for a twin daybed in my spare bedroom. After allowing it the time to expand and acclimate I laid on this myself and it felt like heaven. My nephew came to visit and slept over on it and really likes it.. I told my sister about it and they came on sale for black Friday and she bought 2 of these (twins) for her kids and they absolutely love their new mattresses so I would absolutely recommend. I may even buy a queen later for my own bedroom :)Shipping was very fast and they are exactly as pictured, no weird odors, no complaints I can give whatsoever

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Softer than expected
reviews.reviewText: I read the reviews and hoped that it would be a good mix between firm and soft and in my opinion i think it’s a little too soft and forms against your body. Not my cup of tea but if that’s what you’re looking to get then I would go with this bed. Comfy but overall not what I was hoping for

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is actually a good mattress. I was honestly skeptical, but was pleasantly surprised. However, it doesn’t quite fit the full size bed frame that we got, it is a bit small. It is comfortable and our 10 year old is very happy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It's an ok less expensive choice
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the NapQueen 8 Inch Maxima Hybrid Mattress, and while it has some positive aspects, there are a few drawbacks that prevent me from giving it a higher rating.Let's start with the positives. The mattress arrived promptly and was relatively easy to set up. I appreciated the convenience of having it delivered directly to my doorstep in a compact box. The hybrid design, combining memory foam and innerspring coils, initially seemed promising in terms of both support and comfort.However, after sleeping on the mattress for a few weeks, I noticed some issues. While the mattress does provide adequate support for my back, I found it to be firmer than expected. As a side sleeper, I prefer a softer surface that conforms to the curves of my body, but I felt that this mattress lacked the plushness I was hoping for.Additionally, I experienced some motion transfer, which was surprising considering the hybrid construction. I could feel movement from my partner during the night, which occasionally disrupted my sleep. While it wasn't a dealbreaker, it was definitely a noticeable drawback.Another concern is the durability of the mattress. After only a few weeks of use, I noticed some indentations forming in the foam layer, particularly in areas where I tend to sleep. While this may be expected to some extent with memory foam mattresses, I was hoping for better longevity given the price point of the NapQueen mattress.Overall, the NapQueen 8 Inch Maxima Hybrid Mattress is a decent option for those seeking a budget-friendly mattress with hybrid construction. It provides adequate support and convenience, but the firmness level may not be suitable for everyone, and there are some durability concerns to consider. While it didn't quite meet my expectations, it may still be a suitable choice for others with different preferences.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars a comfortable and supportive mattress
reviews.reviewText: The NapQueen 8 Inch Maxima Hybrid Mattress is a comfortable and supportive mattress that combines memory foam and innerspring coils to provide a great sleeping experience. This mattress has a medium-firm feel that is ideal for all types of sleepers, whether you prefer sleeping on your back, stomach, or side.One of the things that sets this mattress apart is its unique hybrid design. The memory foam layer on top of the innerspring coils provides excellent pressure relief, while the coils give the mattress a bouncy and supportive feel. This combination of materials creates a mattress that is both comfortable and durable.The NapQueen 8 Inch Maxima Hybrid Mattress also has great edge support, which means you can sleep comfortably without worrying about falling off the bed. The mattress also does a good job of isolating motion, which means you won't be disturbed by your partner's movements during the night.In terms of price, the NapQueen 8 Inch Maxima Hybrid Mattress is a great value. It's priced lower than many other hybrid mattresses on the market, but it still delivers a high level of comfort and support.Overall, if you're looking for a comfortable, supportive, and affordable hybrid mattress, the NapQueen 8 Inch Maxima Hybrid Mattress is a great choice. Its unique combination of memory foam and innerspring coils provides a great sleeping experience, and its medium-firm feel is suitable for all types of sleepers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My grandson is extra tall and often spends weekends with us. I purchased this bed when he got too big for a regular bed. This fits him just fine, and he is working on 6 ft. and growing. The bed is surprisingly comfortable! Caution needs to be used when unpacking this tightly coiled mattress: Stand back when you release the Kraken! My sister stayed with us a couple of weeks and she reported that the mattress was extremely comfortable. So it meets approval with a 15 year old and a 70 year old. Winner winner!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Cheap and not so comfortable
reviews.reviewText: The NapQueen Twin-XL Mattress is a hybrid mattress that combines cooling gel-infused memory foam and innerspring for a medium feel. It’s 8 inches thick and comes in a convenient bed-in-a-box packaging.Unfortunately, the mattress didn’t live up to my expectations. While it’s marketed as having a medium feel, I found it to be quite firm. This made it less comfortable than I had hoped, especially for side sleeping.The cooling gel-infused memory foam was also a bit of a letdown. It didn’t seem to provide as much cooling as expected, which led to some uncomfortable, warm nights.In conclusion, the NapQueen Twin-XL Mattress didn’t provide the comfort and cooling I was looking for. While it might be suitable for those who prefer a firmer mattress and don’t sleep particularly hot, it wasn’t the right fit for me. I’m giving it 2 stars.

reviews.reviewText: it’s definitely a bed but the springs make it uncomfortable and doesnt expand fully.

reviews.reviewTitle: The price, the quick arrival and the quality are impressive!
reviews.reviewText: I am so impressed that this came in such a small box, yet within days it inflated to a reasonable level. It is comfortable and absolutely worth it.
